channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3425] A Pictorial Guide to Computer Hardware
item.description: From every kind of memory to A/V input/outputs, processors, and hard drives, this guide shows in easy-to-recognize pictorial form the possible guts in your computer. It's either a really useful quick guide, or the nerdiest poster we've ever seen.

item.title: [+3307] Straight BUM Genius! [PIC]
[+3257] No, Comcast, that is NOT what I meant!
[+1614] Nirvana vs Rick Astley
[+1612] Carter leaves Southern Baptists citing treatment of women.
item.description: "Women and girls have been discriminated against for too long in a twisted interpretation of the word of God" said Jimmy Carter, Former US president, Nobel Prize Winner

item.title: [+1586] A tea giving you the joys of ..... [PIC]
[+1381] Atheist ad campaigns come in peace, love and understanding
item.description: In the grand scheme of things, it seems odd that the question of whether or not God exists is so controversial. Just as some people go to church and others don't, the dividing line between atheism and belief is largely a private concern, relegated to how people spend their weekends and, to some extent, how they explain their actions.

item.title: [+1259] Mysterious G-Men in Black SUVs Guard Fiber-Optic Cable in DC
item.description: A construction crew putting up an office building in the heart of congested Tysons Corner in McLean, Va., hit a fiber-optic cable no one knew was there. Within moments, three black SUVs drove up, half a dozen men in suits jumped out, and one said, "You just hit our line."

item.title: [+1248] Zombie Costume [PIC]
[+1240] AT&T is a big steamy pile of junk
item.description: Att decided it wouldn't be important to let people know that the visual voicemail system wasn't working properly.

item.title: [+1234] Sarah Palin should just go home or The rise of Idiot America
item.description: "The rise of Idiot America ... is essentially a war on expertise ... In the new media age, everybody is a historian, or a scientist, or a preacher, or a sage. And if everyone is an expert, then nobody is, and the worst thing you can be in a society where everybody is an expert is, well, an actual expert." ~ Charles P. Pierce, from "Idiot America"

item.title: [+1068] Starbucks to Start Selling Beer: Can I have a Venti?
item.description: After building an empire based on caffeine, Starbucks is mixing it up and giving beer and wine a shot.

item.title: [+946] Building a TV typewriter in 1973
[+895] Exxon faces $1 billion fine for sabotaging Texas oil wells
item.description: ExxonMobil’s sabotage of some 100 Texas oil wells in the past 17 years — going so far as to plug up some wells with explosives — means the world’s largest oil company could be liable for penalties of up to $1 billion, the Texas General Land Office says.

item.title: [+854] DRM is Dead, RIAA Says
item.description: For years the RIAA has defended the use of DRM, much to the dislike of millions of honest customers who actually paid for their music. Now, in a shocking turnaround, the outfit seems to have come to the realization that DRM does more harm than good and has officially declared its death.

item.title: [+774] Catholic church excommunicated 9-year old rape victim
item.description: We now have an official document from the Catholic church clearly stating their position. Anyone involved in an abortion for any reason is to be automatically excommunicated, no exceptions. They've actually hardened their position.

item.title: [+693] Jack and His Magic Beans
item.description: Jack finds some beans and grows a "special" beanstalk.

item.title: [+689] Open Letters to Annoying People
item.description: Letters are a good way to communicate with people that you, for one reason or another, can't have a face-to-face interaction with. This can be particularly effective when you're dealing with someone who is incredibly annoying. Here are some letters that we'd like to send to some particularly frustrating people.

item.title: [+628] Yes, Android for your Laptop - Live CD or USB
item.description: Live Android, a prject hosted on Google Code website, providing you live iso file for android. Installing android on acer aspire one,dell mini,hp mini or any netbook
